resolution: Verify database service status. If stopped, restart the service. Check network connectivity between the application server and database host. Review database logs for authentication or configuration errors.

symptom: High CPU usage on application server
resolution: Identify top CPU-consuming processes using system monitoring tools. Restart or reconfigure runaway processes. If load is legitimate, consider scaling resources or load balancing.
Clear temporary files and logs older than 30 days. Move large archival data to external storage. If space issues persist, plan for disk expansion.

symptom: Web application returning 500 Internal Server Error
resolution: Check application logs for stack traces or unhandled exceptions. Restart the application service. If recent code changes were deployed, roll back and retest.
Verify SMTP service status and configuration. Check DNS MX records. Review mail server logs for spam filter rejections or authentication errors.
Run network diagnostics to identify latency or packet loss. Check for bandwidth-heavy processes. Restart network equipment if necessary.
Obtain a new certificate from a trusted CA. Install and configure it on the web server. Test HTTPS access to confirm resolution.
Verify username and password. Check account status in the directory service. Reset password if required and ensure authentication services are operational.
Review application logs for errors introduced by the update. Roll back to the previous stable version. Test in staging before redeploying.
Check backup logs for error codes. Verify destination storage availability and permissions. Restart the backup job after resolving issues.
